text: no matter how bad things may seem they
can always get worse and there's no
better reminder of this sad fact than
Ron Akira Kurosawa's 1985 masterpiece
from the last phase of his career one of
the bleakest and harshest movies I've
ever seen and also one of the most
staggeringly beautiful I can't think of
very many other examples of films that
have such a variety of different visual
effects so coherently blended together
so you have these wide horizontal
compositions a sense of vertical scale
that almost makes you dizzy and these
intimate scenes that take place indoors
or just in ragged drab landscapes cool
dispute Ron which is set in medieval
Japan unfolds on a plane of archetype
and myth a familiar escorted top under
thought someone will hold it but it's
also full of very realistic performances
and it works nicely as a study of human
behavior and psychology funding each
color was it ever she wanted you can
walk will open you want a job see that
tonight I'm on a time limit are you with
him the story in Ron is suggested by
Shakespeare's King Lear an ageing
warlord usually accompanied by his fool
decides to split up his lands in his
castle among his three sons and as soon
as he does this all hell breaks loose
King there is certainly one of
Shakespeare's more desolate tragedies
but it does at least have at its heart
the idea or ideal of benevolent
Authority and a reasonable political
rhogam in Ron though the elderly Lord
ichimonji the glir figure is revealed to
have been all along as bloodthirsty and
cruel as any of his sons who stood on
top she carry Karasawa was a master of
the samurai genre and in Ron he dwells
as he often did on military heroes and
the women who love and manipulate and
die for them Rishi don't come with more
technology these characters at least
have a heroic destiny ahead of them
either of conquest or of noble death but
what about the rest of us our fate is
suggested by the film's haunting final
shot it shows us not a military hero but
a minor character named tsurumaru a
blind man an innocent victim of the war
that rages all around him who's lost the
last protection that he had a picture of
the Buddha and now he stands alone in
the midst of ruins at the edge of the
abyss
